posts.name: Can Toğran
posts.cooked:
Hello all,

The vision template here covers a great amount of PhotonVision examples, yet is there an updated version for the Auto Align command in RobotContainer to drive the robot with the closed loop method (runVelocity) in the Swerve Template code?

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: The vision and swerve templates provide some very simple examples of auto aim; the vision template includes a simple command to rotate towards a target in frame, and the swerve template includes a command to drive while pointing towards a target example. These projects are designed as starting point, and we expect users to implement additional logic on top of them. There are many different approaches to auto aim, and we provide foundational elements that you’ll need to implement them (swerve controls, simple targeting data, and/or pose estimation).

posts.name: Can Toğran
posts.cooked: For a starting point, calculating the necessary rotation for auto aim and passing it into the closed loop drive command should work, right?

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: From what I see, that wouldn’t be passing in the rotation as a goal, that would be passing in the rotation as a speed. If you do it like that, you’re likely to overshoot. I would recommend using a PID , and passing in the goal measurement, then passing the output of the PID into your drivetrain.

posts.name: Can Toğran
posts.cooked: The aim controller is a PID controller though:

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: Oh sorry, I didn’t realize you were passing it into a controller. Yes, that ought to work. The one thing you need to ensure is that you have a gyro that you’re passing into the controller.

posts.name: Can Toğran
posts.cooked:
Following up on this, we tried to implement aim and ranging simultaneously as described in this example .

0.222 is the reef april tag from the ground in meters, 0.18 is the limelight lens angle from the ground. We have it tilted 20 degrees, which is configured in the Web UI. When we run this example, the robot just marches forwards without stopping at the tag.

link_counts.title: Aiming and Ranging Simultaneously | Limelight Documentation

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: The first thing I would check is the unit that you’re passing into your PID controllers. Is it 15 meters, 15 inches, etc.  I would also try printing out what the measurement is, and watching that as your robot attempts to align. When I say the measurement, I’m referring to whatever you have set as your feedback for the PID controller.
